content.description: Right to left traverse. Start matched on the bomb-diggity jugs on the right side of the slab wall. Pick your way across left using various crimpy hands and searching for feet. For just the horizontal, quite contrived, experience, match finish on a spicy final fold of rock.
content.location: 36.093889, -84.828056. Follow the pink trail (west side) to the road, follow the road to the stream. Cross the stream and head up the steep hill past the Jackie Paper boulder. Once you hit the cliff band, go right for about 100 yards, past the small cave (Jingly Bells).

climbs.name: Nausicaä & The Valley of the Wind

content.description: Starting by the tree closest to the riverLeft hand on a nice sidepull crimp under the mini roof. right hand on a pinchy sloper. traverse out left, around the corner and up the Arête facing east. Top out on the gently overhung prow.
content.location: From Moss mouth follow the trail along the cliff band, when you reach an ugly iron band roof decend down and slightly left into the valley. Huge triangle shaped stand alone boulder.

content.description: Start on ledge under the roof. Climb out the roof and topout the angled prow.
content.location: 36.096878, -84.824702Approach as for the West Side but before the bottom of the hill cut left into the woods and hike south past a couple boulders to the Pioneer Boulder.

content.description: Start on the large pocket at chest height. Head straight up through the thin seams to a another good pocket. Jugs above make for a logical stopping point, or head up the whole wall if you are feeling brave and it's clean and dry.
content.location: About 30 feet to climbers right from "Jingly Bells". 36.093889, -84.828056

content.description: Starting on left side crimps follow good and bad holds along the arête and top out on the shared top out right of the bulge.
content.protection: At least 2-3 pads with a spotter. The top out is pretty terrifying without a spotter as you might fall in the river.
content.location: 36.09351, -84.82616It’s an island in the river you can’t miss it. 4 stars for the view.

content.description: Start sitting deep in the cave. Climb out the cave using the shelf on your right. Figure out how to use some small crimps to pull onto the face and reach the jugs. Head up as far as your heart desires. Fun moves out the cave!
content.protection: 2 pads. Maybe more if topping out the cliff
content.location: Follow the pink trail (west side) to the road, follow the road to the stream. Cross the stream and head up the steep hill past the Jackie Paper boulder. Once you hit the cliff band, go right for about 100 yards to the small cave. 36.093889, -84.828056

content.description: Starting on low beautiful sloper move through pockets to a jug to jug drive by move. Top out between the top horn and lower sloper. Best climb for the grade at FH. Low start on two pockets to add a grade (Arête IS OFF)Sit starting on the low heucos goes around V4 zero stars. The moves are terrible.
content.protection: A few pads. The crux is at the bottom.
content.location: 36.09373, -84.82731Following the pink trail to the road past bat cave walk down hill to cross the creek and up another ridge to the boulder.

content.description: Starting on iron deposit mail box work left to a good side pull and sloper straight out to a three finger pocket. Foot switchery gains you a right hand undercling and better holds on the southern face to top out.Beta Video-instagram.com/p/CIl_ttgB_Hc…
content.location: Take the bulldozer road on the back western side of the climbers camp until you see a trail off left marked by an over turned boulder. The obvious trail will lead to a long boulder roof. Brice and Big Wally start on the last two roofs before it cuts off.

content.description: Start on left hand meathook undercling  and right hand bad undercling. Shoot out right hand for amazing (but sharp) side pull. Slap the amazing left hand sloper and scum a knee to bump again to better pinch. Right hand to amazing undercling and top straight out from there using every well deserved jugs in sight.Beta video 2 - instagram.com/p/CIl_ttgB_Hc…
The west side boulders are more comparatively more dispersed than the east side. It is home to some of the most scenic boulders such as Margaritaville and Puff the Magic Dragon.
